oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Dallas Frazier - 2006-08-12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by and interview with singer songwriter Dallas Frazier from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on August 12, 2006. Interview moderated by Jay Orr.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes questions from the audience / Program begins in progress / (00:00) Introductory comments by Jay Orr / (03:15) Introduction of Dallas Frazier / (03:53) Dallas talks about his first interest in music and home life / (04:59) Oklahoma roots and dust bowl relocation to Bakersfield California / (06:05) Music in the California community / (06:41) Meeting Ferlin Husky at 12 years old and becoming friends / (09:00) Signing with Capitol Records at 14 years old / (10:40) Working at a cotton gin and writing Alley-Oop and the story behind it / (12:10) Prompted by Ferlin Husky to move to Nashville in 1963 / (13:54) Balancing being a songwriter with being a singer / (14:47) Writing Mohair Sam in 1965 and the story behind it / (17:05) Writing songs while being driven to the demo session / (18:13) Story about writing There Goes My Everything recorded by Jack Greene / (19:41) Performs There Goes My Everything on piano / (22:50) Accolades received for the song /

(23:47) Story about writing If My Heart Had Windows recorded by George Jones / (25:27) Performs If My Heart Had Windows on piano / (28:45) Talks about assignment writing / (29:19) Story about writing Big Mable Murphy recorded by Sue Thompson / (30:51) Plays Big Mable Murphy on piano / (35:07) Story about writing with Buddy Mize and others / (36:00) Pays tribute to his co-writers / (37:30) Story about writing What's Your Mama's Name by Tanya Tucker (38:15) Performs What's Your Mama's Name / (41:16) Talks about what makes a good co-writer / (42:04) Not planning co-writes in advance / (42:34) Story about writing The Baptism of Jason Taylor / (43:41) Performs The Baptism of Jason Taylor on piano / (46:55) Mentions Connie Smith / (47:15) Taking a sabbatical from writing in the 1970's to become a minister / (49:09) Story about writing Elvira recorded by many artists including the Oak Ridge Boys / (51:26) Performs Elvira on piano / (54:27) Questions from the audience /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Frazier, Dallas, 1939-; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
